column4: Hi everyone, I get this error when I put DVDs or CDs in my computer "Unable to mount the selected volume...[CD/DVD name]  mount: Not a directory"... I am using Gutsy. Can someone help me please
a recent dvd player?
it is a very new dell machine
I have already installed multimedia codecs... there is no difference. I still get the same error
posibly dodgy interface from drive to motherboard
did it work on windows or a previous OS?
I installed Ubuntu as soon as I got the machine. So I don't know whether it worked on Windows
possibly a bad connection
or a dodgy drive
How can I fix a bad connection?
wellim not saying it is, but if it was, take the side of the machine and check
so I just make sure the plugs are in properly
yeah
but to be honest i doubt it is that
possibly something to do with software
people have had the eror before, google it
I did google it. This one guy on the forums had the problem and it went away. No one really offered an answer to him
:( sorry mate i cant help anymore, sleepy time
ask someone else :P
thanks anyway
